SEARCH
Package Client.Model

Class GameState

java.lang.Object
Client.Model.GameState
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class GameState extends Object implements Serializable
Represents the state of the game at a particular point in time. Implements Serializable to allow the game state to be saved and loaded.
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • GameState

      public GameState(Player player1, Player player2, Player currentPlayer, Player enemyPlayer, Player winner, int phase, int movesLeft, boolean isGameFinished, String[][] boardState, long remainingTime, boolean vsComputer)
      Constructs a GameState object with the specified parameters.
      Parameters:
      player1 - The first player.
      player2 - The second player.
      currentPlayer - The current player.
      enemyPlayer - The enemy player.
      winner - The player who won the game.
      phase - The current phase of the game.
      movesLeft - The number of moves left.
      isGameFinished - Whether the game is finished.
      boardState - The current state of the board.
      remainingTime - The remaining time for the game.
      vsComputer - Whether the game is against the computer.

  • Method Details

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a string representation of the GameState object. This method constructs a string that includes the values of various fields such as player1, player2, currentPlayer, enemyPlayer, winner, phase, movesLeft, isGameFinished, boardState, remainingTime, and vsComputer.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      A string representation of the current state of the game.
